page.title: 09FARMING IN ROSSENDALE
page.content: Many of the farms around the Cowpe area have good{grazing land}pretty high in the hills.As the going is quite tough the industry is mainly {sheep}and cattle farming.Although the cows are kept in during the winter and fed on good sweet hay which is from the summer before ,they are put out to grass during April and May. On some of the{farms}there are more than two hundred sheep ,as many of them are kept on the tops and fed once a day.Near winter the sheep and lambs are dipped in winter dip which waterproofs them against rain,if they are already wet the dip runs off them .So they must be dry before they are dipped.In rough weather the farmer tends to keep the sheep nearer the farmhouse.Also two times a year, winter and summer, the sheep and lambs walk into a foot bath.
